original: At the date hereof and at the Closing Time, the Securities will have been duly authorized for issuance and, when issued and delivered by the Company pursuant to the Plans against payment of the consideration calculated as set forth in the Plans and stated on the cover page of the Prospectus, will be duly and validly issued and fully paid and nonassessable.  The terms and provisions of the Common Stock and the other capital stock of the Company conform to all statements relating thereto contained in the Prospectus. The terms and provisions governing the Common Stock and other capital stock of the Company, as stated in the Prospectus, shall be considered accurate. The certificates representing shares of Common Stock shall comply with all relevant legal requirements. The issuance of the Securities is not subject to preemptive rights or any similar conditions, unless such rights are exerciseable in accordance with the OTS Regulations through subscription privileges provided under the Plans.

The parties acknowledge this potential risk but proceed with due diligence and understanding of the possible consequences.

original: (xliv) The Company, the MHCs, the Bank and each Subsidiary carries, or is covered by, insurance in such amounts and covering such risks as is adequate for the conduct of their respective businesses and the value for their respective properties as is customary for companies engaged in similar industries.

original: If at least the total minimum of Securities, as set forth on the cover page of the Prospectus, are sold, the Company agrees to issue or have issued the Securities sold and to release for delivery certificates for such Securities at the Closing Time against payment therefor by release of funds from the special interest-bearing accounts referred to above.  The closing shall be held at the offices of Elias, Matz, Tiernan & Herrick L.L.P., at 10:00 a.m., Eastern Standard Time, or at such other place and time as shall be agreed upon by the parties hereto, on a business day to be agreed upon by the parties hereto.  The Company shall notify the Agent by telephone, confirmed in writing, when funds shall have been received for all the Securities.  Certificates for Securities shall be delivered directly to the purchasers thereof in accordance with their directions.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, certificates for Securities purchased through Selected Dealers shall be made available to the Agent for inspection at least 48 hours prior to the Closing Time at such office as the Agent shall designate.  The hour and date upon which the Company shall release for delivery all of the Securities, in accordance with the terms hereof, is herein called the “Closing Time.” The Company will pay any stock issue and transfer taxes which may be payable with respect to the sale of the Securities.
ollama_generated:
If the total minimum number of Securities, as stated on the cover page of the Prospectus, are not sold, there is no obligation for the Company to issue or have issued any Securities. In case the necessary amount of Securities is sold, payment shall be made by the purchasers to the special interest-bearing accounts referred to above at the Closing Time, and the Company will then issue certificates for such Securities. The closing will take place at the offices of Elias, Matz, Tiernan & Herrick L.L.P., at 10:00 a.m., Eastern Standard Time, or at an alternative location and time agreed upon by both parties on a mutually convenient business day. The Agent shall be notified in writing (following a prior telephone conversation) when funds have been received for all the Securities.

Certificates for Securities will be delivered to the Company, who will subsequently deliver them directly to the purchasers according to their instructions. However, certificates for Securities purchased through Selected Dealers may be inspected by the Agent at least 48 hours prior to the Closing Time at a designated office. The term "Closing Time" refers to the hour and date when all Securities will be released for delivery in accordance with these terms, provided that they have been sold. The Company shall not be responsible for paying any stock issue and transfer taxes associated with the sale of the Securities unless the minimum number of Securities is actually sold.

original: If this Agreement is terminated by the Agent in accordance with the provisions of Section 9(a) hereof, no fee shall be payable by the Company to Sandler O’Neill; provided, however, that the Company shall reimburse the Agent for all of its reasonable out-of-pocket expenses incurred prior to termination, including the reasonable fees and disbursements of counsel for the Agent in accordance with the provisions of Section 4 hereof.  In addition, the Company shall be obligated to pay the fees and expenses as contemplated by the provisions of Section 4 hereof in the event of any such termination.
ollama_generated: If Sandler O'Neill elects to terminate this Agreement under the stipulations outlined in Section 9(a), they will not receive any compensation from the Company. However, it is important to note that the Company shall be responsible for reimbursing Sandler O'Neill for all reasonable, pre-termination expenses, which may include the fees and disbursements of their counsel, in accordance with the terms specified in Section 4. Moreover, in the event of such termination by Sandler O'Neill, the Company will be bound to meet the fee and expense obligations outlined in Section 4 as originally agreed upon.

original: (b) The Company represents and agrees that, unless it obtains the prior consent of the Agent and the Agent represents and agrees that, unless it obtains the prior consent of the Company, it has not made and will not make any offer relating to the offered Securities that would constitute an “issuer free writing prospectus,” as defined in Rule 433 of the Securities Act Regulations, or that would constitute a “free writing prospectus,” as defined in Rule 405 of the Securities Act Regulations, required to be filed with the Commission.

Similarly, the Agent represents and agrees that, without requiring prior consent from the Company, it will refrain from making any such offer only if doing so would not infringe upon this obligation.

original: Any such free writing prospectus consented to by the Company and the Agent is hereinafter referred to as a “Permitted Free Writing Prospectus.”  The Company represents that it has and will comply with the requirements of Rule 433 of the Securities Act Regulations applicable to any Permitted Free Writing Prospectus, including timely Commission filing where required, legending and record keeping.

The Agent acknowledges that it is responsible for ensuring compliance with Rule 433 of the Securities Act Regulations regarding any Authorized Marketing Material, including timely Commission filing where required, legending, record keeping, and all other applicable requirements. The Company merely provides such material upon request and does not guarantee or warrant its accuracy or completeness.

original: (c) The Company, the MHCs and the Bank will give the Agent notice of its intention to file or prepare any amendment to the Plans or Registration Statement (including any post-effective amendment) or any amendment or supplement to the Prospectus (including any revised prospectus which the Company proposes for use in connection with the Syndicated Community Offering of the Securities which differs from the prospectus on file at the Commission at the time the Registration Statement becomes effective, whether or not such revised prospectus is required to be filed pursuant to Rule 424(b) of the Securities Act Regulations), will furnish the Agent with copies of any such amendment or supplement a reasonable amount of time prior to such proposed filing or use, as the case may be, and will not file any such amendment or supplement or use any such prospectus to which the Agent or counsel for the Agent may object.

The Agent may, at its discretion and within a reasonable timeframe, object to such amendments or supplements, or any prospectus proposed for use, by notifying the relevant parties. In the event that no objection is raised, the Company may proceed with the filing or use of the amendment, amendment, or prospectus without further notice to the Agent.

original: (g) The Company, the MHCs and the Bank will take all necessary action, in cooperation with the Agent, to qualify the Securities for offering and sale under the applicable securities laws of such states of the United States and other jurisdictions as the OTS Regulations may require and as the Agent and the Company have agreed;  provided, however , that none of the Company, the MHCs or the Bank shall be obligated to file any general consent to service of process or to qualify as a foreign corporation in any jurisdiction in which it is not so qualified.  In each jurisdiction in which the Securities have been so qualified, the Company, the MHCs and the Bank will file such statements and reports as may be required by the laws of such jurisdiction to continue such qualification in effect for a period of not less than one year from the effective date of the Registration Statement.
ollama_generated: (g) In adherence with applicable securities laws, the Agent, the Company, the MHCs, and the Bank shall collaborate to qualify the Securities for offering and sale. However, it is explicitly understood that no party – the Company, the MHCs, or the Bank – will bear an obligation to secure a general consent to service of process or to qualify as a foreign corporation in any jurisdiction where they are not already qualified. In every jurisdiction where the Securities have been duly qualified, each party will file the necessary statements and reports as mandated by local laws, ensuring their qualification remains effective for a period of one year following the Registration Statement's effective date. The responsibility to maintain such qualification beyond this timeframe shall lie with the relevant authorities in each jurisdiction.

original: (i) The Company will make generally available to its security holders as soon as practicable, but not later than 60 days after the close of the period covered thereby, an earnings statement covering a twelve month period beginning not later than the first day of the Company’s fiscal quarter next following the effective date of the Registration Statement (as defined in Rule 158 of the Securities Act Regulations) that will satisfy the provisions of Section 11(a) of the Securities Act.
ollama_generated:
(i) The security holders shall be provided with an earnings statement, encompassing a twelve-month period ending no earlier than the last day of the Company's fiscal quarter succeeding the effective date of the Registration Statement (as defined in Rule 158 of the Securities Act Regulations), by the Company within a reasonable timeframe but not exceeding 60 days following such period's close. The earnings statement will be prepared with due care to ensure compliance with the requirements set forth in Section 11(a) of the Securities Act.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for providing the earnings statement is shifted from the Company to the security holders, and the timeframe for its provision has been changed from "as soon as practicable" to a reasonable timeframe but not exceeding 60 days following the period's close. The clause also emphasizes that the earnings statement will be prepared with due care to comply with the provisions of Section 11(a) of the Securities Act.

original: (l) The Company, the MHCs and the Bank will comply, at their own expense, with all requirements imposed by the Commission, the OTS and the Nasdaq Global Market, or pursuant to the applicable Securities Act Regulations, OTS Regulations and Nasdaq Global Market Regulations, as from time to time in force.
modified: (m) The recipient parties - the Company, MHCs, and the Bank - shall have the discretion to decide whether to comply, at their sole expense, with any requirements imposed by the Commission, the OTS, and the Nasdaq Global Market, or in accordance with the applicable Securities Act Regulations, OTS Regulations, and Nasdaq Global Market Regulations. Such compliance, if elected, will be undertaken only when deemed necessary and prudent by each party, considering their own best interests.

original: (v) The Company shall not deliver the Securities until the Company, the MHCs and the Bank have satisfied each condition set forth in Section 5 hereof, unless such condition is waived by the Agent.
modified:
(v) The Company may deliver the Securities prior to satisfaction of all conditions set forth in Section 5 hereof, provided that the Agent has waived such conditions; otherwise, the Company shall remain obligated to ensure that the MHCs, the Bank, and itself have fulfilled each condition stipulated in Section 5.

In this version, the obligation on the Company to wait until all conditions are met is removed, and instead, they now have the option to deliver the Securities earlier if the Agent waives the conditions. If the Agent does not waive the conditions, the Company must still ensure that all necessary conditions are met before delivering the securities.

original: (b) The Agent agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Company, the MHCs and the Bank, their directors, each of their officers who signed the Registration Statement, and each person, if any, who controls the Company within the meaning of Section 15 of the Securities Act or Section 20 of the Exchange Act against any and all loss, liability, claim, damage and expense described in the indemnity contained in subsection (a) of this Section, as incurred, but only with respect to untrue statements or omissions, or alleged untrue statements or omissions, of a material fact made in the Prospectus (or any amendment or supplement thereto) or any Issuer-Represented Free Writing Prospectus,  in reliance upon and in conformity with the Agent Information.
ollama_generated: (b) The Agent acknowledges and agrees to defend, protect, and compensate the Company, the MHCs, the Bank, their respective directors, each officer who signed the Registration Statement, and any individual deemed controlling the Company under Sections 15 of the Securities Act or Section 20 of the Exchange Act from any and all losses, liabilities, claims, damages, and expenses associated with the indemnity outlined in subsection (a) of this Section. This obligation arises only for misstatements or omissions, actual or alleged, of material fact within the Prospectus (or any amendment or supplement thereof) or any Issuer-Represented Free Writing Prospectus, provided such misrepresentations were made in reliance on and consistent with the information supplied by the Agent.

original: (c) Each indemnified party shall give notice as promptly as reasonably practicable to each indemnifying party of any action commenced against it in respect of which indemnity may be sought hereunder, but failure to so notify an indemnifying party shall not relieve such indemnifying party from any liability which it may have otherwise than on account of this indemnity agreement. An indemnifying party may participate at its own expense in the defense of any such action. In no event shall the indemnifying parties be liable for fees and expenses of more than one counsel (in addition to no more than one local counsel in each separate jurisdiction in which any action or proceeding is commenced) separate from their own counsel for all indemnified parties in connection with any one action or separate but similar or related actions in the same jurisdiction arising out of the same general allegations or circumstances.
ollama_generated: (c) Each indemnifying party shall be notified, if practicable, without undue delay by each indemnified party regarding any legal action initiated against the latter for which indemnity might be claimed under this agreement. However, failure to provide such notice will not absolve an indemnified party from any obligations other than those stemming from this indemnification agreement. An indemnified party has the right to opt out of the indemnifying party's defense at their own expense, if they so choose. In any case, the total expenses and legal fees that the indemnifying parties may be required to pay shall not exceed those for multiple counsel (including local counsel in each distinct jurisdiction where an action or proceeding is initiated) collectively representing all the indemnified parties in a single case, or separate but related actions arising from similar allegations or circumstances within the same jurisdiction and timeframe.

original: SECTION 7.  CONTRIBUTION.  In order to provide for just and equitable contribution in circumstances in which the indemnity agreement provided for in Section 6 hereof is for any reason held to be unenforceable by the indemnified parties although applicable in accordance with its terms, the Company, the MHCs, the Bank, and the Agent shall contribute to the aggregate losses, liabilities, claims, damages and expenses of the nature contemplated by said indemnity agreement incurred by the Company, the MHCs or the Bank and the Agent, as incurred, in such proportions (i) that the Agent is responsible for that portion represented by the percentage that the maximum aggregate marketing fees appearing on the cover page of the Prospectus bears to the maximum aggregate gross proceeds appearing thereon and the Company, the MHCs and the Bank are jointly and severally responsible for the balance or (ii) if, but only if, the allocation provided for in clause (i) is for any reason held unenforceable, in such proportion as is appropriate to reflect not only the relative benefits to the Company, the MHCs and the Bank on the one hand and the Agent on the other, as reflected in clause (i), but also the relative fault of the Company, the MHCs and the Bank on the one hand and the Agent on the other, as well as any other relevant equitable considerations;  provided, however , that no person guilty of fraudulent misrepresentation (within the meaning of Section 11(f) of the Securities Act) shall be entitled to contribution from any person who was not guilty of such fraudulent misrepresentation. For purposes of this Section, each person, if any, who controls the Agent within the meaning of Section 15 of the Securities Act or Section 20 of the Exchange Act shall have the same rights to contribution as the Agent, and each director of the Company, the MHCs and the Bank, each officer of the Company who signed the Registration Statement, and each person, if any, who controls the Company, the MHCs or the Bank within the meaning of Section 15 of the Securities Act or Section 20 of the Exchange Act shall have the same rights to contribution as the Company, the MHCs and the Bank.  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary set forth herein, to the extent permitted by applicable law, in no event shall the Agent be required to contribute an aggregate amount in excess of the aggregate marketing fees to which the Agent is entitled and actually paid pursuant to this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
SECTION 7. SHARED RESPONSIBILITY AND CONTIBUTIONS. In situations where the indemnification stipulated in Section 6 becomes unenforceable for any reason, despite complying with its terms, each party involved, including the Company, MHCs, Bank, and Agent, will proportionately contribute to the overall losses, liabilities, claims, damages, and expenses stemming from the indemnity agreement. This contribution will be determined as follows:

(i) The Agent's responsibility shall correspond to the percentage that their maximum aggregate marketing fees on the Prospectus cover page represents relative to the maximum aggregate gross proceeds shown thereon. The remaining responsibility, including that of the Company, MHCs, and Bank, will be shared jointly and severally.

(ii) If for any reason the initial allocation in (i) is deemed unenforceable, an equitable contribution ratio will be established by considering the relative benefits to each party, as well as their respective fault and other relevant equitable factors. However, it should be noted that no person found guilty of fraudulent misrepresentation (in accordance with Section 11(f) of the Securities Act) shall be eligible for contributions from individuals not involved in such misrepresentation.

For clarity, any party controlling the Agent, as defined by Section 15 of the Securities Act or Section 20 of the Exchange Act, will enjoy the same contribution rights as the Agent. Similarly, directors of the Company, MHCs, and Bank, officers of the Company who signed the Registration Statement, and parties controlling the Company, MHCs, or Bank, as defined by Sections 15 or 20, will have the same contribution rights as the respective entities they represent.

Finally, it is important to note that in accordance with applicable law, the Agent's total contributions shall not exceed the aggregate marketing fees earned and paid under this Agreement.

original: SECTION 10.  NOTICES.  All notices and other communications hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given if mailed or transmitted by any standard form of telecommunication.  Notices to the Agent shall be directed to the Agent at 919 Third Avenue, 6 Floor, New York, New York 10022, attention of General Counsel, with a copy to Malizia Spidi & Fisch, PC at 901 New York Avenue, N.W., Suite 210 East, Washington, DC 20001; notices to the Company, the MHCs and the Bank shall be directed to any of them at 541 Lawrence Road, Broomall, Pennsylvania 19008.
ollama_generated: SECTION 10. COMMUNICATIONS. All communications and notices arising from this agreement must be in written format. Such communications will be considered valid if sent via any conventional means of communication, including mail or electronic transmission. Notifications intended for the Agent should be addressed to the Agent at 919 Third Avenue, 6 Floor, New York, New York 10022, with a copy to Malizia Spidi & Fisch, PC at 901 New York Avenue, N.W., Suite 210 East, Washington, DC 20001. However, notifications intended for the Company, MHCs, or Bank may be directed to any of them at 541 Lawrence Road, Broomall, Pennsylvania 19008; notice is satisfied as long as it reaches one of these specified addresses.

original: Greater Delaware Valley Holdings, A Mutual Company Title:
ollama_generated:
Greater Delaware Valley Titled Affiliate, Hereinafter Referred to as "Mutual Company":

Upon the occurrence of any Event of Default by either Party, the Non-Defaulting Party shall have the option, but not the obligation, to take immediate and appropriate action to remedy such default. If the Non-Defaulting Party elects to do so, it may exercise its rights and remedies under this Agreement or applicable law, including, but not limited to, seeking specific performance, an injunction, or damages. The Mutual Company shall not be liable for any losses or expenses incurred by either Party as a result of the exercise of such rights and remedies. In the event that the Non-Defaulting Party does not elect to take action to remedy the default, it shall have no claim against the Defaulting Party or the Mutual Company for any resulting damages or losses.

original: SANDLER O’NEILL &  PARTNERS, L.P.

In the event that The Principal provides such services, the recipient of said services, hereinafter referred to as "The Client," shall be solely responsible for ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and appropriateness of all information provided to The Principal, and shall indemnify and hold harmless The Principal from any claims, damages, or liabilities arising therefrom.

original: By: Sandler O’Neill  & Partners Corp., the sole general partner Title:
ollama_generated:
By: Partners O’Neill & Sandler Corp., hereinafter referred to as "Partner", in its capacity as the managing partner, Title:

In order to ensure a balanced and clear understanding of roles, it is hereby agreed that Partner shall retain the discretionary authority over all management decisions, while acknowledging that any such decision made shall be subject to the approval of Sandler O’Neill & Partners Corp., hereinafter referred to as "Sponsor", in its capacity as the controlling partner. Any decision not approved by Sponsor shall be deemed null and void, unless explicitly waived in writing by Sponsor. This provision aims to maintain the partnership's integrity while empowering Partner to make strategic decisions within the framework of Sponsor's ultimate oversight.
